node.title: Three Canberrans in hospital after eating suspected death cap mushrooms
node.description: Three people presented to hospital emergency rooms in the ACT this week after eating wild mushrooms, suspected to be poisonous death caps.
node.content:
["Three people have presented to emergency departments in the ACT\u00a0this week after eating wild mushrooms.", "ACT Health authorities said they had not\u00a0been able to confirm whether the trio had ingested death cap mushrooms \u2014 with investigations still underway.", "Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith said\u00a0the deadly fungus had\u00a0been spotted in parts of the Canberra region in recent weeks, including Yass and Goulburn.", "\"While this is not the normal time of year for death cap mushroom growth in the ACT, it is a timely reminder to people not to pick and eat wild mushrooms,\" she said.", "
Death caps in Canberra
", "Death cap mushrooms have a long history in the nation's capital,\u00a0popping up in the city's suburbs most years \u2014 usually in autumn.", "Death caps are not native to Australia, but were accidentally introduced from the northern hemisphere and have taken root in the ACT.", "", "
Death cap mushrooms grow under established oak trees in warm, wet autumnal weather such as these in Dickson, Canberra.(ABC News: Penny McLintock)
", "The poisonous fungus grows under established oak trees, and thrives in\u00a0wet weather \u2014 as\u00a0Canberra has experienced in the past few weeks.", "Death caps are a very dangerous mushroom,\u00a0causing liver damage, which can be fatal.", "The mushrooms are often confused for straw mushrooms, a commonly eaten variety in Asia that\u00a0looks very similar.", "There have been four recorded deaths\u00a0by death cap ingestion in the ACT.", "
How to know if you've eaten a death cap
", "", "
Death caps can cause liver damage when ingested, which can be toxic.(ABC News: Penny McLintock )
", "Symptoms of poisoning generally appear between six and 24 hours after ingesting the death cap and can begin with nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea.", "After consuming, patients can appear to be recovering, however, by this stage, the toxin can have caused serious liver damage, which can be fatal.", "Death cap poisoning is considered a medical emergency,\u00a0if you suspect you have eaten some, go to\u00a0hospital immediately.\u00a0", "If you need more information or assistance regarding a suspected poisoning call the Poisons Information Centre on 13 11 26 \u2014 available 24 hours a day, seven days a week."]
